Social Security supporters are adamant that the program will be repaid, just as the U.S. government repays others who invest in U.S. Treasury bonds. It's an IOU that is backed by Treasury bonds and the faith and credit of the United States government, said Barack Obama Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt. added that he's already talked to Andy Reid about what he needs to improve on this offseason. ''I think I've got the blueprint on what to do,'' Michael Vick said. I sat down and talked with Andy yesterday. He had a whole list of things that he thought I needed to do. It's good because without that I wouldn't see it or I wouldn't know, so that gives me guidance, areas to work on. Michael Vick admitted that he tried too often to make a big play last season. improvement and he's going to be even better next year.'' Tony Dungy is very confident that Michael Vick will remain a Philadelphia Eagle even though 2010 was the final year of his two-year deal. He wants to come back; the Eagles want him, Tony Dungy says. ''He has so much gratitude to Andy and Jeffrey Lurie . I'd just really be shocked if he's not back.''
